comment.body:
> [wakelain](#comment_1_1K7pivtg6E1qRnih7nmnnPrCnRRSxSCMQQ): wow mp4 embeds are working as well? thats amazing

Sure! you can add any HTML code

> [wakelain](#comment_1_1K7pivtg6E1qRnih7nmnnPrCnRRSxSCMQQ): wow mp4 embeds are working as well? thats amazing

But the video is not stored on ZeroNet but on the IPFS network
Soon or later, Artificial Intelligence animation will be real, and the examples showed here are not the bests we can find right now.

Some nice AI “animations”:
- Flexible Muscle-Based Locomotion for Bipedal Creatures: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pgaEE27nsQw
- Locomotion Skills for Simulated Quadrupeds: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dRthdBr46cs
- A Deep Learning Framework for Character Motion Synthesis and Editing (SIGGRAPH 2016): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=urf-AAIwNYk
- Guided Learning of Control Graphs for Physics-based Characters (SIGGRAPH 2016): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QJbCfhRkcyg

> [jop](#comment_1_1LuTR1QEnMJDUNLYbtsi7nzNfwcJGAyHRU): No soy para nada un FAN de ciertas tecnologias... sobre todo cuando veo como se aplican en ciertas instituciones y en ciertos paises... creo, que es tremendamente necesario luchar por una legislacion que prohiba su uso en ciertas areas.

No creo que se pueda frenar fácilmente el avance de la tecnología, pero si creo que es importante estudiar su posible impacto a futuro

> [zalex](#comment_1_1LWuc6JBhUGrKEAh1aPrPU85dEMcKmg3pS): I suggest a table view, like this:
> | IP Number | Port | Code | Country | Version |
> | - | -| - | - | - |
> | 123.134.185.156 | 1080 | CN | China | Socks5 |
> And then just replace - with | (in the text editor). It looks much better (as for me).

Thanks Zalex, apparently my version of ZeroBlog don't support Tables

> [zalex](#comment_2_1LWuc6JBhUGrKEAh1aPrPU85dEMcKmg3pS): I turned on "My site" and I made a nice table (in my local copy of your site), it works. Just paste raw markdown like in my comment.Note: second row | - | - | - | - | - | is important.

Great, is working now! XD

> [wanditoast](#comment_1_1LJMKSLPgM8fqQSMRrLzWB2DhVm1zoEVfZ): Videos aren't available.

If you don't have IPFS and IPFS browser addon installed the videos are loading from a public gateway. It might take a few seconds to syncronize.

EDIT: I didn't realized I had the ports closed, that might be slowing things down
Blender is already testing PeerTube: https://video.blender.org/videos/trending
